required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Strategies for the Treatment of Severely Calcified Coronary Lesions-2 Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Strategies for the Treatment of Severely Calcified Coronary Lesions (ISAR-CALC)-2 Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this prospective, multicenter, randomized, open-label trial is to investigate stent expansion as assessed by optical coherence tomography (OCT) imaging following a strategy of super high-pressure balloon (OPN NC) versus intravascular lithotripsy (IVL) for drug-eluting stent (DES) implantation in severely calcified coronary lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Stent expansion index as assessed by OCT imaging.
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure of the trial is stent expansion index, defined as minimum stent area divided by mean reference lumen area assessed with OCT imaging.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as target lesion residual angiographic stenosis < 30% in the presence of Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction (TIMI)-3 flow.
Defined as angiographic success without the occurrence of major adverse cardiac event (MACE), a composite of cardiac death, target-vessel related MI and repeat revascularization, up to 30 days.
Defined as procedural success using the assigned study device and stent, without additional devices for lesion preparation.
Defined as minimal lumen diameter (MLD) after balloon angioplasty with the study devices minus baseline MLD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Need for complementary lesion preparation with rotational atherectomy.

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with a Super high-pressure percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) balloon (OPN NC).
Patients will be treated with intravascular lithotripsy (IVL).

intervention.description: Strategy of super high-pressure balloon angioplasty after unsuccessful lesion preparation with conventional NC balloon angioplasty. Following lesion preparation, stenting will be performed in the same setting using a latest-generation DES. Post-dilatation will be mandatory in all patients and will be performed with a super high-pressure balloon.

Strategy of IVL after unsuccessful lesion preparation with conventional NC balloon angioplasty. Following lesion preparation, stenting will be performed in the same setting using a latest-generation DES. Post-dilatation will be mandatory in all patients and will be performed with a conventional NC balloon.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age above 18 years
- Persistent angina despite medical therapy and/or evidence of inducible ischemia
- De-novo lesion in a native coronary artery
- Severe calcification of the target lesion as determined by visual estimation at coronary angiography
- Unsuccessful lesion preparation with standard non-compliant balloon (< 30% reduction of baseline diameter stenosis at maximal pressure)
- Written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Target lesion is located in a coronary artery bypass graft
- Target lesion is an in-stent restenosis
- Target lesion is a chronic total occlusion
- Target vessel thrombus
- Limited long-term prognosis due to other comorbid conditions
